sen.j: 久安百首（きゅうあんひゃくしゅ）は、平安時代後期の1150年（久安6年）、崇徳院の命により作成した百首歌。
sen.e: Kyuan Hyaku shu is the Hundred-Poem sequences developed by the command of Sutoku-in during 1150 in the late Heian period.
Kyuan Hyakushu is the Hundred-Poem sequences developed by the command of Sutokuin in 1150 during the late Heian period.

sen.j: 久安六年百首、崇徳院御百首とも称される。
sen.e: It is also referred to as Kyuan Rokunen Hyakushu (Hundred Poems of the Sixth Year of Kyuan) and Sutokuin Hyakushu (Hundred Poems for Sutokuin).

sen.j: 康治年間（1142年～1144年）に崇徳院から題が下され、作者は崇徳院のほか藤原公能、藤原教長、藤原顕輔、藤原俊成など14名であるが、途中で死去により入れ替わった作者もいる。
sen.e: Between 1142 and 1144, Sutokuin set subjects for poems and while there were 14 writers including FUJIWARA no Kinyoshi, FUJIWARA no Norinaga, FUJIWARA no Norinaga and FUJIWARA no Toshinari in addition to Sutokuin himself, some of them died along the way and were replaced by the other poets.

sen.j: 現存するものは、歌人の百首を題ごとに分類しないで載せているものと、藤原俊成によって10巻に分類されたものの2種類がある。
sen.e: There are 2 different existing versions of Kyuan Hyakushu including the one listing the hundred poems without sorting by the subject and the other which was broken down into 10 volumes by FUJIWARA no Toshinari.
